author: TravisEz13
body:
<!--

If you are running a released version of powershell, but not the latest one, install the latest from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases and try to repro it again

Before submitting this issue, please first:

- [X] Search the existing issues.
- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](../docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to the [known issues](../docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- [X] If it is a bug, fill out this form:
-->
## Steps to reproduce

Go to any linux CI build and look for artifacts
Go to the home page of the project and look at the link to get the build
## Expected behavior

There should be a link to get the latest passed CI build from the development branch (currently master)
## Actual behavior

The link to get the build is a fixed release (which is needed, but something different)

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: All we've been needing for this is a place to store the artifacts. Travis can upload automatically to an AWS account.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: Assigning @TravisEz13 to find a place to store the packages.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: Going with AWS, assigning this back to me.

title: Build for linux should produce artifacts
